wreck.中释: 破坏，船舶失事；失事船只

lofty.英释: lofty mountains, buildings etc are very high and impressive

sieve.英释: A sieve is a tool used for separating solids from liquids or larger pieces of something from smaller pieces. It consists of a metal or plastic ring with a wire or plastic net underneath, which the liquid or smaller pieces pass through.

grave.英释: the place in the ground where a dead body is buried

claim.英释: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

civic.英释: relating to a town or city

clash.中释: 金属碰撞声；互碰；时间冲突；抵触
clash.英释: if two armies, groups etc clash, they start fighting – used in news reports

strap.英释: to fasten something or someone in place with one or more straps

dwell.英释: to live in a particular place

shred.英释: to cut or tear something into small thin pieces

rural.英释: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

annoy.英释: to make someone feel slightly angry and unhappy about something

sweep.英释: if winds, waves, fire etc sweep a place or sweep through, across etc a place, they move quickly and with a lot of force

dizzy.英释: feeling unable to stand steadily, for example because you are looking down from a high place or because you are ill

glare.英释: to look angrily at someone for a long time

lucid.中释: 清楚的，易懂的，神智清醒的
lucid.英释: expressed in a way that is clear and easy to understand

elite.英释: You can refer to the most powerful, rich, or talented people within a particular group, place, or society as the elite

vital.中释: 生命的；必需的；极期重要的
vital.英释: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

oxide.英释: a substance which is produced when a substance is combined with oxygen

carry.中释: 传送，运送；带有；支持；赞同
carry.英释: to take people or things from one place to another in a vehicle, ship, or plane

weave.英释: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom

overt.英释: overt actions are done publicly, without trying to hide anything

flank.英释: the side of an animal’s or person’s body, between the  ribs  and the  hip

alter.英释: to change, or to make someone or something change

sheer.英释: A sheer cliff or drop is extremely steep or completely vertical

tease.英释: to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way

endow.英释: to give a college, hospital etc a large sum of money that provides it with an income

marsh.英释: an area of low flat ground that is always wet and soft

gauge.中释: 标准尺寸,(铁道)轨矩;雨量器；(电线)直径 "
gauge.英释: the width of the barrel of a gun

spare.英释: an additional thing, for example a key, that you keep so that it is available

means.英释: a way of doing or achieving something

torch.英释: a small electric lamp that you carry in your hand

swing.英释: to make regular movements forwards and backwards or from one side to another while hanging from a particular point, or to make something do this

choir.英释: a group of people who sing together for other people to listen to

hatch.英释: if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

check.英释: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition

chase.英释: to quickly follow someone or something in order to catch them

yearn.英释: to have a strong desire for something, especially something that is difficult or impossible to get

naked.英释: not wearing any clothes or not covered by clothes

essay.英释: a short piece of writing giving someone’s ideas about politics, society etc

stiff.中释: 坚硬的；费劲的；不易弯的
stiff.英释: firm, hard, or difficult to bend

toxic.英释: containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances

wield.英释: to have a lot of power or influence, and to use it

grope.英释: to try to find something that you cannot see by feeling with your hands

mania.英释: a strong desire for something or interest in something, especially one that affects a lot of people at the same time

quest.英释: a long search for something that is difficult to find

grief.英释: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died

sheet.英释: a large piece of thin cloth that you put on a bed to lie on or lie under

eject.英释: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

curve.英释: a line that gradually bends like part of a circle

towel.英释: a piece of cloth that you use for drying your skin or for drying things such as dishes

plumb.英释: to succeed in understanding something completely

forum.英释: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

fibre.英释: the parts of plants that you eat but cannot  digest  . Fibre helps to keep you healthy by moving food quickly through your body.

adapt.英释: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

charm.中释: 吸引力，可爱之处，迷人；行魔法
charm.英释: a special quality someone or something has that makes people like them, feel attracted to them, or be easily influenced by them – used to show approval

ratio.英释: a relationship between two amounts, represented by a pair of numbers showing how much bigger one amount is than the other

unify.中释: 使联合，统一，使相同，一致
unify.英释: if you unify two or more parts or things, or if they unify, they are combined to make a single unit

ridge.英释: a long area of high land, especially at the top of a mountain

motif.英释: an idea, subject, or image that is regularly repeated and developed in a book, film, work of art etc

dairy.英释: a place on a farm where milk is kept and butter and cheese are made

drown.中释: 淹死，(高声音)遮掩(低声音)
drown.英释: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way

loath.英释: to be unwilling to do something

guild.英释: an organization of people who do the same job or have the same interests

drill.英释: to train soldiers to march or perform other military actions

dodge.英释: to move quickly to avoid someone or something

clasp.英释: a small metal object for fastening a bag, belt, piece of jewellery etc

medal.英释: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

faint.英释: to suddenly become unconscious for a short time

toast.英释: to drink a glass of wine etc to thank some-one, wish someone luck, or celebrate something

chasm.中释: 断层，裂口；巨大分歧，差别
chasm.英释: a big difference between two people, groups, or things

swift.英释: happening or done quickly and immediately

chart.英释: information that is clearly arranged in the form of a simple picture, set of figures,  graph  etc, or a piece of paper with this information on it

drift.英释: a slow change or development from one situation, opinion etc to another

fluid.英释: a situation that is fluid is likely to change

swamp.英释: land that is always very wet or covered with a layer of water

shrug.英释: to raise and then lower your shoulders in order to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

flush.英释: if two surfaces are flush, they are at exactly the same level, so that the place where they meet is flat

catch.英释: to see someone doing something that they did not want you to know they were doing

gaunt.英释: very thin and pale, especially because of illness or continued worry

tonic.中释: 滋补品，补药；强身的，健体的
tonic.英释: a drink that you have as a medicine to give you more energy or strength when you feel tired

thumb.英释: the part of your hand that is shaped like a thick short finger and helps you to hold things

extra.中释: 额外的/地，非常，另外；额外的人
extra.英释: Extras are additional amounts of money that are added to the price that you have to pay for something

patch.英释: to repair a hole in something by putting a piece of something else over it

trace.英释: to copy a drawing, map etc by putting a piece of transparent paper over it and then drawing the lines you can see through the paper

craft.中释: 工艺；手工业；船；技巧；诡计
craft.英释: a job or activity in which you make things with your hands, and that you usually need skill to do

gleam.中释: 微光，闪光，短暂而微弱的闪现

cease.英释: to stop doing something or stop happening

ditch.英释: to stop having something because you no longer want it

range.英释: to put things in a particular order or position

flesh.英释: the soft part of the body of a person or animal that is between the skin and the bones

flame.英释: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire

crush.中释: 压碎，压坏，弄皱，压垮；挤入
crush.英释: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged

organ.英释: a newspaper or magazine which gives information, news etc for an organization or group

pants.英释: a piece of clothing that covers you from your waist to your feet and has a separate part for each leg

merit.英释: to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

rival.英释: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

stain.中释: 染料，着色剂，污点，沾污处
stain.英释: to accidentally make a mark on something, especially one that cannot be removed, or to be marked in this way

dwarf.英释: to be so big that other things are made to seem very small

frail.英释: someone who is frail is weak and thin because they are old or ill

cheer.英释: a shout of happiness, praise, approval, or encouragement

oasis.英释: a place with water and trees in a desert

fetch.英释: If you fetch something or someone, you go and get them from the place where they are

shock.英释: if something that happens is a shock, you did not expect it, and it makes you feel very surprised, and usually upset

glide.英释: to move smoothly and quietly, as if without effort

freak.中释: 怪诞的思想、行动或事件；畸形的
freak.英释: someone who is considered to be very strange because of the way they look, behave, or think

apply.英释: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something

havoc.英释: a situation in which there is a lot of damage or a lack of order, especially so that it is difficult for something to continue in the normal way

purge.英释: to force people to leave a place or organization because the people in power do not like them

title.中释: 标题；题目；称号；法律权利，所有权
title.英释: the name given to a particular book, painting, play etc

scorn.英释: the feeling that someone or something is stupid or does not deserve respect

album.英释: a book that you put photographs, stamps etc in

creep.中释: 爬行；缓慢移行；(时间)悄悄过去；蔓延
creep.英释: if something such as an insect, small animal, or car creeps, it moves slowly and quietly

stall.中释: 分隔栏；售货摊；前排座位
stall.英释: a table or a small shop with an open front, especially outdoors, where goods are sold

staff.英释: People who are part of a particular staff are often referred to as staff

score.英释: a written or printed copy of a piece of music, especially for a large group of performers, or the music itself

pilot.英释: someone who operates the controls of an aircraft or spacecraft

logic.英释: a way of thinking about something that seems correct and reasonable, or a set of sensible reasons for doing something

onset.英释: the beginning of something, especially something bad

roast.英释: to cook something, such as meat, in an  oven  or over a fire, or to cook in this way

phase.中释: 阶段；月的盈亏；方面;相位vt按计划进行
phase.英释: one of the stages of a process of development or change

crack.中释: 裂缝，破裂声；v使破裂；噼啪作响；解开
crack.英释: a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something

aware.英释: if you are aware that a situation exists, you realize or know that it exists

thigh.英释: the top part of your leg, between your knee and your  hip

ideal.英释: the best or most suitable that something could possibly be

rivet.中释: 铆接，铆牢；集中(目光或注意力)

plank.英释: a long narrow piece of wooden board, used especially for making structures to walk on

pedal.英释: one of the two parts of a bicycle that you push round with your feet to make the bicycle go forward

inert.英释: not producing a chemical reaction when combined with other substances

faith.英释: a strong feeling of trust or confidence in someone or something

upset.英释: to change a plan or situation in a way that causes problems

slice.英释: to cut meat, bread, vegetables etc into thin flat pieces

flake.英释: a small thin piece that breaks away easily from something else

truce.英释: an agreement between enemies to stop fighting or arguing for a short time, or the period for which this is arranged

issue.英释: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc

motto.英释: a short sentence or phrase giving a rule on how to behave, which expresses the aims or beliefs of a person, school, or institution

weary.中释: 疲倦的，困乏的；令人厌倦的
weary.英释: very tired or bored, especially because you have been doing something for a long time

proxy.英释: if you do something by proxy, you arrange for someone else to do it for you

stale.英释: bread or cake that is stale is no longer fresh or good to eat

evade.英释: to avoid talking about something, especially because you are trying to hide something

fleet.英释: a group of ships, or all the ships in a navy

irony.中释: 反话，冷嘲，讽刺性的事件、情况等
irony.英释: a situation that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true

polar.英释: close to or relating to the North Pole or the South Pole

inapt.英释: an inapt phrase, statement etc is not right for a particular situation

thorn.英释: a sharp point that grows on the stem of a plant such as a rose

linen.英释: cloth made from the flax plant, used to make high quality clothes, home decorations etc

piety.英释: when you behave in a way that shows respect for your religion

panel.中释: 镶板，控制板；座谈小组；镶饰
panel.英释: a board in a car, plane, boat etc that has the controls on it

mould.英释: a hollow container that you pour a liquid or soft substance into, so that when it becomes solid, it takes the shape of the container

erupt.英释: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

atlas.英释: a book containing maps, especially of the whole world

dingy.英释: dark, dirty, and in bad condition

merge.英释: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

token.英释: something that represents a feeling, fact, event etc

shift.中释: 位置转移，性格转变；轮班
shift.英释: a change in the way people think about something, in the way something is done etc

flare.英释: if a person or animal flares their  nostril s (= the openings at the end of the nose )  , or if their nostrils flare, their nostrils become wider because they are angry

shoal.英释: a large group of fish swimming together

hasty.英释: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

chaos.英释: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

comic.中释: 喜剧的，滑稽的n连环漫画杂志；喜剧演员
comic.英释: amusing you and making you want to laugh

slack.中释: 懈怠的；萧条的；呆滞的；松驰的；不紧的
slack.英释: hanging loosely, or not pulled tight

fancy.中释: 颜色鲜艳的;奇特的n&v想象力,设想,爱好
fancy.英释: fancy food is of a high quality

gaudy.英释: clothes, colours etc that are gaudy are too bright and look cheap – used to show disapproval

chant.英释: to repeat a word or phrase again and again

fraud.英释: the crime of deceiving people in order to gain something such as money or goods

pitch.中释: 球场；声音的高低度；沥青；程度v投掷
pitch.英释: a marked out area of ground on which a sport is played

grace.英释: to make a place or an object look more attractive

acute.中释: 厉害的，敏锐的，(疾病等)急性的
acute.英释: an acute illness or disease quickly becomes very serious

corps.英释: a trained army unit made of two or more  divisions (= groups of soldiers )

petal.英释: one of the coloured parts of a flower that are shaped like leaves

strip.英释: a long narrow area of land

prior.英释: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

track.英释: Tracks are marks left in the ground by the feet of animals or people

expel.英释: to officially force someone to leave a school or organization

flash.英释: to shine suddenly and brightly for a short time, or to make something shine in this way

undue.英释: more than is reasonable, suitable, or necessary

suite.中释: 一套家具，一套房间，酒店套房
suite.英释: a set of rooms, especially expensive ones in a hotel

siege.英释: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

shrub.英释: a small bush with several woody stems

heave.英释: a strong pulling, pushing, or lifting movement

clear.英释: to make somewhere emptier or tidier by removing things from it

chord.英释: a combination of several musical notes that are played at the same time and sound pleasant together

crust.英释: the hard brown outer surface of bread

mourn.英释: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died

arise.英释: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

repel.英释: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

stuff.英释: to fill something until it is full

screw.英释: to fasten or close something by turning it, or to be fastened in this way

stick.英释: to attach something to something else using a substance, or to become attached to a surface

pains.英释: Pain is the feeling of unhappiness that you have when something unpleasant or upsetting happens

rigid.中释: 僵硬的，不易弯的；严格的
rigid.英释: rigid methods, systems etc are very strict and difficult to change

ferry.英释: a boat that carries people or goods across a river or a narrow area of water

feast.英释: A feast is a large and special meal

petty.英释: a petty problem, detail etc is small and unimportant

exile.英释: someone who has been forced to live in exile

nylon.英释: a strong artificial material that is used to make plastics, clothes, rope etc

grill.英释: a part of a  cooker  in which strong heat from above cooks food on a metal shelf below

naval.英释: relating to the navy or used by the navy

lapse.中释: 小错，记错；(时间)流逝；[律]权利终止

grant.英释: an amount of money given to someone, especially by the government, for a particular purpose

sewer.英释: a pipe or passage under the ground that carries away waste material and used water from houses, factories etc

realm.英释: a country ruled by a king or queen

loyal.英释: always supporting your friends, principles, country etc

scoop.英释: an important or exciting news story that is printed in one newspaper or shown on one television station before any of the others know about it

stand.英释: to support yourself on your feet or be in an upright position

grind.中释: 磨碎，折磨，压榨，磨光；苦差使
grind.英释: to make something smooth or sharp by rubbing it on a hard surface or by using a machine

snack.英释: a small amount of food that is eaten between main meals or instead of a meal

trait.英释: a particular quality in someone’s character

rouse.英释: to wake someone who is sleeping deeply

rough.中释: 不平的；粗鲁的，粗略的；刺耳的

queer.中释: 奇怪的，不平常的；可疑的；眩晕的

scout.英释: a soldier, plane etc that is sent to search the area in front of an army and get information about the enemy

graph.英释: a drawing that uses a line or lines to show how two or more sets of measurements are related to each other

liner.英释: A liner is a large ship in which people travel long distances, especially on holiday

hobby.英释: an activity that you enjoy doing in your free time

spoil.英释: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc

probe.中释: 医学探针；新闻调查；探测
probe.英释: to ask questions in order to find things out, especially things that other people do not want you to know

trail.英释: to pull something behind you, especially along the ground, or to be pulled in this way

spray.英释: Spray is a lot of small drops of water which are being thrown into the air

march.英释: when soldiers walk with firm regular steps from one place to another

legal.英释: if something is legal, you are allowed to do it or have to do it by law

pivot.英释: The pivot in a situation is the most important thing that everything else is based on or arranged around

orbit.英释: to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

lobby.英释: If you lobby someone such as a member of a government or council, you try to persuade them that a particular law should be changed or that a particular thing should be done

avert.英释: to prevent something unpleasant from happening

evoke.英释: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

mercy.英释: if someone shows mercy, they choose to forgive or to be kind to someone who they have the power to hurt or punish

sting.英释: if an insect or a plant stings you, it makes a very small hole in your skin and you feel a sharp pain because of a poisonous substance

hedge.英释: a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, usually dividing one field or garden from another

drain.英释: a pipe that carries water or waste liquids away

taboo.英释: a taboo subject, word, activity etc is one that people avoid because it is extremely offensive or embarrassing

style.英释: a particular way of doing, designing, or producing something, especially one that is typical of a particular place, period of time, or group of people

avoid.英释: to prevent something bad from happening

notch.英释: a V-shaped cut or hole in a surface or edge

peril.英释: great danger, especially of being harmed or killed

tacit.英释: tacit agreement, approval, support etc is given without anything actually being said

whirl.英释: If something or someone whirls around or if you whirl them around, they move around or turn around very quickly

swell.中释: 使膨胀；使增强，使壮大，使隆起
swell.英释: to curve or make something curve

gross.英释: If a person or a business grosses a particular amount of money, they earn that amount of money before tax has been taken away

prone.英释: likely to do something or suffer from something, especially something bad or harmful

pupil.英释: the small black round area in the middle of your eye

frost.中释: 严寒，霜v结霜;使(玻璃)具有光泽的表面
frost.英释: very cold weather, when water freezes

ample.英释: large in a way that is attractive or pleasant

dread.英释: to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

scale.中释: 鳞；尺度；等级；比例规模；天平
scale.英释: the size or level of something, or the amount that something is happening

alien.中释: 外侨；外国人的；不相容的
alien.英释: someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

light.英释: the time when light first appears in the morning sky

facet.英释: one of several parts of someone’s character, a situation etc

click.英释: to make a short hard sound, or make something produce this sound

amend.英释: to correct or make small changes to something that is written or spoken

abort.英释: to deliberately end a  pregnancy  when the baby is still too young to live

poise.英释: a calm confident way of behaving, combined with an ability to control your feelings or reactions in difficult situations

cling.英释: If someone clings to a position or a possession they have, they do everything they can to keep it even though this may be very difficult

flock.英释: a group of sheep, goats, or birds

filth.英释: very offensive language, stories, or pictures about sex

haste.英释: great speed in doing something, especially because you do not have enough time

carve.英释: to make an object or pattern by cutting a piece of wood or stone

steep.英释: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

frown.英释: to make an angry, unhappy, or confused expression, moving your  eyebrows  together

crash.英释: an accident in which a vehicle violently hits something else

vomit.英释: to bring food or drink up from your stomach out through your mouth, because you are ill

porch.英释: an entrance covered by a roof outside the front door of a house or church

shaft.英释: a passage which goes down through a building or down into the ground, so that someone or something can get in or out

dense.英释: made of or containing a lot of things or people that are very close together

tinge.中释: (较淡)着色于，染色；使带有气息
tinge.英释: to give something a small amount of a particular colour, emotion, or quality

nasty.中释: 令人作呕的，令人不快的，下流的
nasty.英释: someone who is nasty behaves in an unkind and unpleasant way

trunk.英释: the thick central woody stem of a tree

elbow.英释: to push someone with your elbows, especially in order to move past them

slope.英释: a piece of ground or a surface that slopes

idiot.英释: someone who is mentally ill or has a very low level of intelligence

forge.英释: to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real

telex.中释: 用户电报；直通专用电传
telex.英释: a method of communica-tion, in which messages are written on a special machine and then sent using the telephone network

graze.中释: (牲畜)吃草；放牧；擦过(牲畜)n擦伤
graze.英释: to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something

layer.英释: an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things

vogue.英释: a popular and fashionable style, activity, method etc

excel.英释: to do something very well, or much better than most people

mount.英释: used as part of the name of a mountain

crawl.英释: a way of swimming in which you lie on your stomach and move one arm, and then the other, over your head

affix.英释: a group of letters added to the beginning or end of a word to change its meaning or use, such as ‘un-’, ‘mis-’, ‘-ness’, or ‘-ly’

verge.英释: the edge of a road, path etc

crumb.英释: a very small piece of dry food, especially bread or cake

array.英释: An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way

gland.英释: an organ of the body which produces a substance that the body needs, such as hormones, sweat, or saliva

shell.英释: the outside structure of something, especially the part of a building that remains when the rest of it has been destroyed

aisle.英释: a long passage between rows of seats in a church, plane, theatre etc, or between rows of shelves in a shop

scant.中释: 不足的，不够多的，缺乏的

comet.英释: an object in space like a bright ball with a long tail, that moves around the sun

valve.英释: a part of a tube or pipe that opens and shuts like a door to control the flow of liquid, gas, air etc passing through it

grand.中释: 最重大的；豪华的；傲慢的；美妙的
grand.英释: used in the titles of buildings or places that are big and impressive

defer.英释: to delay something until a later date

trick.英释: something you do in order to deceive someone

alloy.英释: a metal that consists of two or more metals mixed together

reign.英释: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

yacht.英释: a large boat with a sail, used for pleasure or sport, especially one that has a place where you can sleep

equal.中释: 相等的，相等于，相等匹敌
equal.英释: to be exactly the same in size, number, or amount as something else

heart.英释: the organ in your chest which pumps blood through your body

argue.英释: to state, giving clear reasons, that something is true, should be done etc

sound.中释: 健康的，健全的；可靠的，充分的；彻底的

focus.英释: to give special attention to one particular person or thing, or to make people do this

wager.英释: to agree to win or lose an amount of money on the result of something such as a race

fault.中释: 缺点；毛病，过错；(地质)断层
fault.英释: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

yield.英释: the amount of profits, crops etc that something produces

steak.英释: good quality  beef  , or a large thick piece of any good quality red meat

width.英释: the distance from one side of something to the other

float.英释: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

trial.英释: a legal process in which a judge and often a  jury  in a court of law examine information to decide whether someone is guilty of a crime

waver.英释: to become weaker or less certain

virus.英释: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

outdo.英释: to be better or more successful than someone else at doing something

decay.英释: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this

audit.英释: an official examination of a company’s financial records in order to check that they are correct

vivid.中释: 鲜艳的；活泼的，有生气的；清晰的
vivid.英释: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

rally.英释: a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

stoop.中释: 弯腰，俯身；屈从，堕落，沦为
stoop.英释: to bend your body forward and down

lever.英释: to move something with a lever

maize.英释: a tall plant with large yellow seeds that grow together on a  cob (= long hard part )  , and that are cooked and eaten as a vegetable

amuse.英释: to make someone laugh or smile

incur.英释: if you incur something unpleasant, it happens to you because of something you have done

offer.英释: a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

tempo.英释: the speed at which music is played or should be played

tough.中释: 坚韧的，咬不动的；强壮的；粗暴的

spark.英释: a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together

lodge.英释: a traditional home of Native Americans, or the group of people that live in it

crisp.英释: to become crisp or make something become crisp by cooking or heating it

minus.英释: used to show that one number or quantity is being  subtract ed  from another

scold.英释: to angrily criticize someone, especially a child, about something they have done

panic.英释: to suddenly feel so frightened that you cannot think clearly or behave sensibly, or to make someone do this

entry.英释: the act of going into something

chunk.英释: a large thick piece of something that does not have an even shape

harsh.英释: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

crude.英释: not exact or without any detail, but generally correct and useful

swarm.英释: if people swarm somewhere, they go there as a large uncontrolled crowd

deter.英释: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

fling.英释: to throw something somewhere using a lot of force

shave.英释: to cut off hair very close to the skin, especially from the face, using a  razor

shear.英释: to cut the wool off a sheep

hover.中释: (鸟)盘旋，翱翔，(人)逗留在附近徘徊
hover.英释: If you hover, you stay in one place and move slightly in a nervous way, for example because you cannot decide what to do

slide.英释: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way

arena.英释: a building with a large flat central area surrounded by seats, where sports or entertainments take place

fluff.英释: to make something soft become larger by shaking it

hoist.英释: a piece of equipment used for lifting heavy objects with ropes

plead.英释: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

laden.英释: heavily loaded with something, or containing a lot of something

theme.英释: the main subject or idea in a piece of writing, speech, film etc

swirl.英释: to move around quickly in a twisting circular movement, or to make something do this

match.中释: 火柴；比赛；对手；婚姻;相称v相当,相配
match.英释: an organized sports event between two teams or people

tutor.英释: someone who gives private lessons to one student or a small group, and is paid directly by them

lease.英释: a legal agreement which allows you to use a building, car etc for a period of time, in return for rent

quota.中释: 配额，限额(进口及移民人数)
quota.英释: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

radar.英释: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement

given.英释: any particular time, situation, amount etc that is being used as an example

couch.英释: to be expressed in a particular way

weird.中释: 怪诞的；离奇的，古怪的；超自然的
weird.英释: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

moped.英释: a small two-wheeled vehicle with an engine

wedge.英释: to force something firmly into a narrow space

swear.英释: to say very strongly that what you are saying is true

leave.中释: 离开，遗忘；保持一定状态；留下
leave.英释: to go away from a place or a person

abuse.英释: the use of something in a way that it should not be used

flour.英释: a powder that is made by crushing wheat or other grain and is used for making bread, cakes etc

smash.英释: to break into pieces violently or noisily, or to make something do this by dropping, throwing, or hitting it

coach.英释: someone who trains a person or team in a sport

scrap.英释: a small piece of paper, cloth etc

asset.英释: the things that a company owns, that can be sold to pay debts

crown.英释: to place a crown on the head of a new king or queen as part of an official ceremony in which they become king or queen

trend.英释: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

haven.英释: a place where people or animals can live peacefully or go to in order to be safe

adopt.英释: to take someone else’s child into your home and legally become its parent

moist.英释: slightly wet, especially in a way that is pleasant or suitable

slate.英释: a dark grey rock that can easily be split into flat thin pieces

chore.中释: 日常工作；琐碎烦人的杂务
chore.英释: a small job that you have to do regularly, especially work that you do to keep a house clean

surge.英释: if a large amount of a liquid, electricity, chemical etc surges, it moves very quickly and suddenly

grate.英释: to rub cheese, vegetables etc against a rough or sharp surface in order to break them into small pieces

stake.英释: if you have a stake in something, you will get advantages if it is successful, and you feel that you have an important connection with it

idiom.英释: a group of words that has a special meaning that is different from the ordinary meaning of each separate word. For example, ‘under the weather’ is an idiom meaning ‘ill’.

spill.英释: if you spill a liquid, or if it spills, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container

motel.英释: a hotel for people who are travelling by car, where you can park your car outside your room

lunar.英释: relating to the Moon or to travel to the Moon

draft.英释: to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form

novel.英释: a long written story in which the characters and events are usually imaginary

sauce.英释: a thick cooked liquid that is served with food to give it a particular taste

hardy.英释: strong and healthy and able to bear difficult living conditions

embed.中释: 把嵌入，使扎根于社会，使深留脑中
embed.英释: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

relay.英释: a piece of electrical equipment that receives radio or television signals and sends them on

scent.英释: if an animal scents another animal or a person, it knows that they are near because it can smell them

clamp.英释: to put a clamp on the wheel of a car so that the car cannot be driven away. This is usually done because the car is illegally parked.

split.英释: if something splits, or if you split it, it tears or breaks along a straight line

ensue.英释: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it

stern.英释: serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour

haunt.英释: a place that someone likes to go to often

cater.中释: 供应伙食；提供娱乐节目
